instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Sensor issue maybe?
threads.message:
Hi all. I put up a post a few days back but it seems to not be showing. However, ASD did finally throw up 2 errors, ( was taking an age to complete). 
Quick recap. A1466 ( 820-3209-A) liquid ingress. Keyboard requires replacement. New one connected. System running very slow. 

Run ASD and 2 errors appeared, as can be seen in the pics. I have replaced the SSD with another and booted from an external drive. Still runs slow. I have replaced the thermal paste on the CPU with the same results. I still suspect a sensor. The logic board has no clear signs of corrosion under a scope. 

Any pointers? [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] has suggested new BIOS with a clean ME but I do not have the equipment at this time to do this. 

thanks in advance.
Marc

threads.title: Sensor issue maybe?
threads.message:
Two errors are related with internal SSD.
Try a known good SSD, or disconnect internal and boot from your USB test OSX.

threads.title: Sensor issue maybe?
threads.message: Tried with an external test O/S, still slow AF. I must have every SSD available for these Mac's apart from the one in it...LOL

threads.title: Sensor issue maybe?
threads.message:
Did you disconnect internal SSD?
Try another trackpad/cable too.
Fan spins high?

threads.title: Sensor issue maybe?
threads.message: Yep, just the external drive connected, nope did not try another cable, will do that now, but I did try with the cable disconnected and a USB mouse, still slow. No fans do not spin high.

threads.title: Sensor issue maybe?
threads.message: Just tried another trackpad and cable, same... :(

threads.title: Sensor issue maybe?
threads.message: Is time to try new BIOS...
